_header: Mary Mother of grace we cryen to Thee
Note: A translation of Anselm’s Admonitio morienti.
Subjects: Virgin Mary, prayers to; sermons, verse in; translations; prayers, to Virgin Mary, and saints
_description: A prayer to the Virgin Mary and All Saints (10 lines), a tag in the Fasciculus morum

Bod410.First Lines:
Mary moder of grace we cry to þemoder of mercy & of
                    pite…
Bod410.Last Lines:
…Help þat ctyst my gyst forȝyf þat will hym
                    serue whill I lyfe

BodLauMis213.First Lines:
Mary modyr of grace we cryin to þeModyr of mercy and of
                    pyte…
BodLauMis213.Last Lines:
…Help þat crist my gult for ȝyfeþat wull hym
                    serue whil I life

BodLauMis111.First Lines:
Mary moder of grace we crye vn to þeModer of mercy and of
                    pyteWyte vs fro þe fendes fondyngeAnd helpe vs at oure last
                    endyng…
BodLauMis111.Last Lines:
…help þat crist my gylt for ȝiueAnd I wol hym serue
                    wil I lyue

BodRawC670.First Lines:
Mary moder of grace we cryen to þeModer of mercy and of
                    pyte…
BodRawC670.Last Lines:
…Helpe þat Cryst my gult forȝeueAnd I wol him serue
                    whyl þat I leue
BodRawC670.Editions:
Woolf,  Rosemary. 
             The English Religious Lyric in the Middle Ages.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1968: 120.
Wenzel,  Siegfried. 
             Verses in Sermons: ‘Fasciculus morum’ and Its Middle
                English Poems.
         Cambridge, MA: Medieval Academy of America, 1978: 143-4.
Silverstein,  Theodore,
                        ed.  
             Medieval English Lyrics.
         York Medieval Texts. London: Edw. Arnold, 1971: 76-7.

CamGon364.First Lines:
Marie moder of grace we crien to þeModer of merci hey & al
                    so of pite…
CamGon364.Last Lines:
…Helpyth þat crist mi gilt forȝeueand i wele hym
                    serue whil i leue

CamStJohn159.First Lines:
Moder of mercy & of piteedefend vs fro þe fendys
                    fondynge…
CamStJohn159.Last Lines:
…helpe þat crist my gylt for gyfAnd swilke hym serue wyl
                    I leyfe
CamStJohn159.Note:
Written as prose; 4 1/2 x 2, or 9 lines in couplets, the first a
                    single.
